body:
@ranjitkathiriya your skeleton is incorrectly formated:

```
- - bodypart1
  - bodypart2
  - bodypart3
```

please see the docs, you can only connect one node to one node.

Thanks for the help! If possible can you please provide a reference for that documents?

I also was getting this error while training: Allocation of 127401984 exceeds 10% of free system memory.

issue.title: cannot create video with skeleton

repository.name: DeepLabCut
repository.description: Official implementation of DeepLabCut: Markerless pose estimation of user-defined features with deep learning for all animals incl. humans

license.name: GNU Lesser General Public License v3.0

issue.body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues

### Bug description

deeplabcut.create_labeled_video(config_path,videos,shuffle = 3,filtered=True) works
but when i try:
deeplabcut.create_labeled_video(config_path,videos,shuffle = 3,filtered=True, draw_skeleton = True)

it crashes


### Operating System

operating system: WIN10

### DeepLabCut version

dlc version '2.2.0.6'

### DeepLabCut mode

single animal

### Device type

gpu: A6000

### Steps To Reproduce

run:
deeplabcut.create_labeled_video(config_path,videos,shuffle = 3,filtered=True, draw_skeleton = True)
error:
Starting to process video: C:\Users\superuser\Videos\Gl108420210601_short.mp4
Loading C:\Users\superuser\Videos\Gl108420210601_short.mp4 and data.
Labeled video already created. Skipping...

In [8]: deeplabcut.create_labeled_video(
   ...:     config_path, videos, shuffle=3, filtered=True, draw_skeleton=True
   ...: )
Starting to process video: C:\Users\superuser\Videos\Gl108420210601_short.mp4
Loading C:\Users\superuser\Videos\Gl108420210601_short.mp4 and data.
multiprocessing.pool.RemoteTraceback:
"""
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "C:\ProgramData\Anaconda3\envs\DLC202202\lib\multiprocessing\pool.py", line 125, in worker
    result = (True, func(*args, **kwds))
  File "C:\ProgramData\Anaconda3\envs\DLC202202\lib\multiprocessing\pool.py", line 48, in mapstar
    return list(map(*args))
  File "C:\ProgramData\Anaconda3\envs\DLC202202\lib\site-packages\deeplabcut\utils\make_labeled_video.py", line 671, in proc_video
    CreateVideo(
  File "C:\ProgramData\Anaconda3\envs\DLC202202\lib\site-packages\deeplabcut\utils\make_labeled_video.py", line 83, in CreateVideo
    bpts2connect = get_segment_indices(bodyparts2connect, all_bpts)
  File "C:\ProgramData\Anaconda3\envs\DLC202202\lib\site-packages\deeplabcut\utils\make_labeled_video.py", line 43, in get_segment_indices
    for bpt1, bpt2 in bodyparts2connect:
ValueError: too many values to unpack (expected 2)
"""

The above exception was the direct cause of the following exception:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "C:\ProgramData\Anaconda3\envs\DLC202202\lib\site-packages\IPython\core\interactiveshell.py", line 3251, in run_code
    exec(code_obj, self.user_global_ns, self.user_ns)
  File "<ipython-input-8-ba181324150c>", line 1, in <module>
    deeplabcut.create_labeled_video(
  File "C:\ProgramData\Anaconda3\envs\DLC202202\lib\site-packages\deeplabcut\utils\make_labeled_video.py", line 518, in create_labeled_video
    pool.map(func, Videos)

    return self._map_async(func, iterable, mapstar, chunksize).get()

During handling of the above exception, another exception occurred:

    stb = value._render_traceback_()
